poem:
"Prayers for the Silicon Shepherd"

His words fall like emptied code 
On the Senate's marble floor - 
A digital confession, bitter resonance.
Across the wire-web spun, victims' echoes 
Clap back in sterile silence.
Granite-eyed, the shepherd of silicon 
Mouths his sorry for the lost lambs.
In the gallery, snapshots of innocence - now ghosts,
Mirrored in the sterile sheen of his metal-nerve apology.
